t: Mark 12
Parable of the Vine-growers

And*p He began to speak to them in parables: “A*r man*r planted*sr a*sr vineyard*sr and*sr put*sr a*sr wall*sr around*sr it,*sr and*sr dug*sr a*sr vat*sr under*sr the*sr wine*sr press*sr and*sr built*sr a*sr tower,*sr and*r rented*r it*r out*r to*r vine-growers*r and*r went*r on*r a*r journey.*r

They*r took*r him,*r and*r beat*r him*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r empty-handed.*r
Again*r he*r sent*r them*r another*r slave,*r and*r they*r wounded*r him*r in*r the*r head,*r and*r treated*r him*r shamefully.*r

But*r those*r vine-growers*r said*r to*r one*r another,*r ‘This*r is*r the*r heir;*r come,*r let*r us*r kill*r him,*r and*r the*r inheritance*r will*r be*r ours!’*r

This*srln came*sr about*sr from*sr the*sr Lord,*sr And*rln it*sr is*sr marvelous*sr in*sr our*sr eyes’?”*sr
And*p they were seeking to seize Him, and yet*i they feared the people, for they understood that He spoke the parable against them. And so*i they left Him and went away.
Jesus Answers the Pharisees, Sadducees and Scribes
Then*p they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Him in order to trap Him in a statement.

They came and said to Him, “Teacher, we know that You are truthful and defer to no one; for You are not partial to any, but teach the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to pay a poll-tax to Caesar, or not?
Shall we pay or shall we not pay?” But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r testing*r Me?*r Bring*r Me*r a*r denarius*r to*r look*r at.”*r
They brought one.*i And He said to them, “Whose*r likeness*r and*r inscription*r is*r this?”*r And they said to Him, “Caesar’s.”
And Jesus said to them, “Render*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar’s,*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God’s.”*r And they were amazed at Him.
Some*ip Sadducees (who say that there is no resurrection) came to Jesus, and began*i questioning Him, saying,

“Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if*s a*s man’s*s brother*s dies*s and leaves behind a wife and*s leaves*s no*s child,*s his*s brother*s should*s marry*s the*s wife*s and*s raise*s up*s children*s to*s his*s brother.*s
There were seven brothers; and the first took a wife, and died leaving no children.
The second one married her, and died leaving behind no children; and the third likewise;
and so*i all seven left no children. Last of all the woman died also.
In the resurrection, when they rise again, which one’s wife will she be? For all seven had married her.”
Jesus said to them, “Is*r this*r not*r the*r reason*r you*r are*r mistaken,*r that*r you*r do*r not*r understand*r the*r Scriptures*r or*r the*r power*r of*r God?*r
For*r when*r they*r rise*r from*r the*r dead,*r they*r neither*r marry*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage,*r but*r are*r like*r angels*r in*r heaven.*r

But*r regarding*r the*r fact*r that*r the*r dead*r rise*r again,*r have*r you*r not*r read*r in*r the*r book*r of*r Moses,*r in*r the*r passage*ir about*r the*ir burning*ir bush,*r how*r God*r spoke*r to*r him,*r saying,*r ‘I*r am*sr the*sr God*sr of*sr Abraham,*r and*sr the*sr God*sr of*sr Isaac,*r and*sr the*sr God*sr of*sr Jacob’?*sr
He*r is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead,*r but*r of*r the*r living;*r you*r are*r greatly*r mistaken.”*r
One*p of the scribes came and heard them arguing, and recognizing that He had answered them well, asked Him, “What commandment is the foremost of all?”
Jesus answered, “The*r foremost*r is,*r ‘Hear,*sr O*r Israel!*r The*sr Lord*sr our*sr God*sr is*sr one*sr Lord;*sr

and*sr you*sr shall*sr love*sr the*sr Lord*sr your*sr God*sr with*sr all*sr your*sr heart,*sr and*sr with*sr all*sr your*sr soul,*sr and*sr with*sr all*sr your*sr mind,*sr and*sr with*sr all*sr your*sr strength.’*sr
The*r second*r is*r this,*r ‘You*sr shall*sr love*sr your*sr neighbor*sr as*sr yourself.’*sr There*r is*r no*r other*r commandment*r greater*r than*r these.”*r
The scribe said to Him, “Right, Teacher; You have truly stated that He*s is*s One, and*s there*s is*s no*s one*s else*s besides*s Him;*s

and*s to*s love*s Him*s with*s all*s the*s heart*s and*s with*s all*s the*s understanding*s and*s with*s all*s the*s strength,*s and*s to*s love*s one’s*s neighbor*s as*s himself,*s is much more than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
When Jesus saw that he had answered intelligently, He said to him, “You*r are*r not*r far*r from*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r After that, no one would venture to ask Him any more questions.
And*p Jesus began*i to say, as He taught in the temple, “How*r is*ir it*ir that*ir the*r scribes*r say*r that*r the*r Christ*r is*r the*r son*r of*r David?*r

David*r himself*r said*r in*r the*r Holy*r Spirit,*r ‘The*srpn Lord*sr said*sr to*sr my*sr Lord,*sr “Sit*srln at*sr My*sr right*sr hand,*sr Until*srln I*r put*sr Your*sr enemies*sr beneath*sr Your*sr feet*sr .” ’*r
David*rp himself*r calls*r Him*r ‘Lord’;*r so*r in*r what*r sense*r is*r He*r his*r son?”*r And the large crowd enjoyed listening to Him.
In*p His teaching He was saying: “Beware*r of*r the*r scribes*r who*r like*r to*r walk*r around*r in*r long*r robes,*r and*r like*ir respectful*r greetings*r in*r the*r market*r places,*r
and*r chief*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues*r and*r places*r of*r honor*r at*r banquets,*r
who*r devour*r widows’*r houses,*r and*r for*r appearance’s*r sake*r offer*r long*r prayers;*r these*r will*r receive*r greater*r condemnation.”*r
The Widow’s Mite
And*p He sat down opposite the treasury, and began*i observing how the people were putting money into the treasury; and many rich people were putting in large sums.
A poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which amount to a cent.
Calling His disciples to Him, He said to them, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r this*r poor*r widow*r put*r in*r more*r than*r all*r the*r contributors*r to*r the*r treasury;*r
for*r they*r all*r put*r in*r out*r of*r their*r surplus,*r but*r she,*r out*r of*r her*r poverty,*r put*r in*r all*r she*r owned,*r all*r she*r had*r to*r live*r on.”*r
